patterns: How do I register for Srinivas University?
How do I apply for admissions?
Where do I fill the application form?
Where do I fill the registration form?
responses: The registration process begins by filling out the online application form available at https://apply.suiet.in/#applynow_2023-24. Please ensure all the required fields are accurately filled.
The online application form can be filled and submitted at https://apply.suiet.in/#applynow_2023-24 . Please ensure all the required fields are accurately completed.
We accept payments via NEFT / Google Pay / PhonePe. A/C holder name: Srinivas University . Bank Name: Bank of Maharashtra . A/C no: 60494317155 . Branch: Hampankatta . IFSC no: MAHB0000381 .
You can pay college fees using NEFT / Google Pay / PhonePe. A/C holder name: Srinivas University . Bank Name: Bank of Maharashtra . A/C no: 60494317155 . Branch: Hampankatta . IFSC no: MAHB0000381 .

patterns: Fees to be paid per year
responses: The total fees per year doesn't exceed more than Rs 1,50,000/- under management quota, except for the first year when you might have additional fees. Please cross-check with the office for precise and accurate amount.
It is roughly Rs 1,50,000/- per year (two semesters) under management quota. Please contact the office for precise and accurate amount.

patterns: Is there a reservation fee for registration?
How can I make the reservation fee of Rs 30,000/- ?
How much do I pay for reserving a seat?
How much is the reservation fees?
How do I reserve a seat?
responses: Yes, there is a reservation fee of Rs. 30,000/- to be paid during the registration process. This amount will be considered as part of the first-year fee.
Reservation fee is of Rs. 30,000/- which will be considered as part of the first-year fee, and is needed to be paid during the registration process.

patterns: What documents do I need to submit for registration?
What documents are needed for admission?
What and all documents should I submit?
responses: Along with the online application form and payment confirmation, you will be required to submit the necessary documents as specified in the registration guidelines. These documents may include academic transcripts, identification proof, and any additional documents as per the chosen program.

patterns: What documents do I need to submit for admission through KCET?
What documents are required for admission under CET quota?
Documents to submit for application through cet
responses: For admission under CET quota, the following documents are required: 4 copies of each document, CET admission order, SSLC marks card, PUC marks card, Transfer & conduct certificate, Certificate - 7 years, Caste/income certificate, PUC marks card.

patterns: Whom do I contact for admission related queries?
Is there anyone I can contact for further information?
What is the office phone number?
I want to talk to a person
I want to talk to office
responses: For any queries, contact +91 824 2412382, +91 824 2444891 or try emailing admission@srinivasuniversity.edu.in

patterns: Can you tell me more about the courses offered?
responses: You can apply for any of the following BTech programmes: Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML), Cyber Security and Cyber Forensics (CSCF), Electronic Communications Engineering (ECE), Mechanical Engineering (Mech), Civil Engineering and Aircraft Maintenance Engineering (AME); or opt for MTech in Computer Science and Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Structural Engineering.

The following branches are available for BTech: Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML), Cyber Security and Cyber Forensics (CSCF), Electronic Communications Engineering (ECE), Mechanical Engineering (Mech) and Civil Engineering. MTech: Computer Science and Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Structural Engineering.

patterns: No that's not what I meant
responses: I'm really sorry I couldn't help you. As I'm just a bot, I have limited functionality when compared to an actual human. You should try contacting the office by calling +91 824 2412382 or +91 824 2444891 if you still have unresolved queries. Can I help you with anything else?
I'm sorry, but I'm unable to help with that at the moment. I apologize for any inconvenience. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
